name: Iron
educationalNotes: Iron is the most common metal in Earth's crust and your blood! Hemoglobin protein carries oxygen using iron - without it, you'd be blue (and dead). Steel (iron + carbon) is the backbone of civilization - buildings, bridges, cars, tools. Iron oxidizes to form rust - a problem costing billions annually. Discovered in meteorites by ancient peoples (why iron has mythical significance). Earth's core is mostly iron. Dietary iron helps prevent anemia - red meat, spinach, and beans are good sources.

diffusion.usage: Sum atomic contributions for compound Σv, then: D_AB = 0.00143×T^1.75 / (P × M_AB^0.5 × (Σv_A^(1/3) + Σv_B^(1/3))²)
